item.title: Python Basics Blog
item.description: ##1. Variables In Python it is really easy to define a variable and set a value to it. ex)two = 2 some_number = 10000 ##2. Control Flow: conditional statements “If” uses an expression to evaluate to True or False. If it is True, it executes what it is inside the if statement. ex)if True: print(“Hello Python If”) if 2 > 1: print(“2 is greater than 1”) The “else” statement will be executed if “if” expression is false
